name: USCoreLocation
title: US Core Location Profile
description: This profile sets minimum expectations for the Location resource for recording, searching for and fetching a Location associated with a patient, provider or organization to promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation.  It identifies which core elements, extensions, vocabularies, and value sets **SHALL** be present and constrains the way the elements are used when using the profile.  It provides the floor for standards development for specific use cases.

elements.name: id
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: identifier
elements.short: Unique code or number identifying the location to its users
elements.description: Unique code or number identifying the location to its users.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.description: The status property covers the general availability of the resource, not the current value which may be covered by the operationStatus, or by a schedule/slots if they are configured for the location.

binding.description: Indicates whether the location is still in use.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: operationalStatus
elements.short: The operational status of the location (typically only for a bed/room)
elements.description: The operational status covers operation values most relevant to beds (but can also apply to rooms/units/chairs/etc. such as an isolation unit/dialysis chair). This typically covers concepts such as contamination, housekeeping, and other activities like maintenance.

binding.description: The operational status if the location (where typically a bed/room).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: name
elements.short: Name of the location as used by humans
elements.description: Name of the location as used by humans. Does not need to be unique.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: alias
elements.short: A list of alternate names that the location is known as, or was known as, in the past
elements.description: A list of alternate names that the location is known as, or was known as, in the past.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: description
elements.short: Additional details about the location that could be displayed as further information to identify the location beyond its name
elements.description: Description of the Location, which helps in finding or referencing the place.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: mode
elements.description: Indicates whether a resource instance represents a specific location or a class of locations.

binding.description: Indicates whether a resource instance represents a specific location or a class of locations.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: type
elements.description: Indicates the type of function performed at the location.

binding.description: Indicates the type of function performed at the location.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: telecom
elements.description: The contact details of communication devices available at the location. This can include phone numbers, fax numbers, mobile numbers, email addresses and web sites.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: address
elements.description: Physical location.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: id
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: use
elements.short: home | work | temp | old | billing - purpose of this address
elements.description: The purpose of this address.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: type
elements.description: Distinguishes between physical addresses (those you can visit) and mailing addresses (e.g. PO Boxes and care-of addresses). Most addresses are both.

binding.description: The type of an address (physical / postal).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.description: Specifies the entire address as it should be displayed e.g. on a postal label. This may be provided instead of or as well as the specific parts.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: XAD.1 + XAD.2 + XAD.3 + XAD.4 + XAD.5 + XAD.6

elements.name: line
elements.short: Street name, number, direction & P.O. Box etc.
elements.description: This component contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction,  P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: XAD.1 + XAD.2 (note: XAD.1 and XAD.2 have different meanings for a company address than for a person address)

elements.name: city
elements.description: The name of the city, town, suburb, village or other community or delivery center.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: district
elements.description: The name of the administrative area (county).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: state
elements.description: Sub-unit of a country with limited sovereignty in a federally organized country. A code may be used if codes are in common use (e.g. US 2 letter state codes).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: postalCode
elements.description: A postal code designating a region defined by the postal service.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: country
elements.short: Country (e.g. can be ISO 3166 2 or 3 letter code)
elements.description: Country - a nation as commonly understood or generally accepted.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: period
elements.short: Time period when address was/is in use
elements.description: Time period when address was/is in use.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: physicalType
elements.description: Physical form of the location, e.g. building, room, vehicle, road.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: position
elements.description: The absolute geographic location of the Location, expressed using the WGS84 datum (This is the same co-ordinate system used in KML).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: longitude
elements.description: Longitude. The value domain and the interpretation are the same as for the text of the longitude element in KML (see notes below).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: (RIM Opted not to map the sub-elements of GPS location, is now an OBS)

elements.name: latitude
elements.description: Latitude. The value domain and the interpretation are the same as for the text of the latitude element in KML (see notes below).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: (RIM Opted not to map the sub-elements of GPS location, is now an OBS)

elements.name: altitude
elements.description: Altitude. The value domain and the interpretation are the same as for the text of the altitude element in KML (see notes below).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: (RIM Opted not to map the sub-elements of GPS location, is now an OBS)

elements.name: managingOrganization
elements.short: Organization responsible for provisioning and upkeep
elements.description: The organization responsible for the provisioning and upkeep of the location.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: partOf
elements.short: Another Location this one is physically a part of
elements.description: Another Location of which this Location is physically a part of.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: hoursOfOperation
elements.short: What days/times during a week is this location usually open
elements.description: What days/times during a week is this location usually open.

elements.name: daysOfWeek
elements.short: mon | tue | wed | thu | fri | sat | sun
elements.description: Indicates which days of the week are available between the start and end Times.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: allDay
elements.short: The Location is open all day
elements.description: The Location is open all day.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: openingTime
elements.description: Time that the Location opens.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: closingTime
elements.description: Time that the Location closes.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: availabilityExceptions
elements.description: A description of when the locations opening ours are different to normal, e.g. public holiday availability. Succinctly describing all possible exceptions to normal site availability as detailed in the opening hours Times.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: endpoint
elements.short: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the location
elements.description: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the location.
